quote: U-Net is the predominant approach to medical image segmentation task.

The U-Net has been a remarkable and the most popular architecture in medical image segmentation and the MultiResUNet can provide a much better output than the U-Net, because it can provide different scales features.
Thus, we assumed that those most challenging tasks would be solved if we can provide more different-scale (more effective) features.
In conclusion, Jaccard similarity is a proper measure if segmentation output is binary but for grayscale images, Tanimoto similarity is better.
The results of EM dataset were shown in Table 6.
DC-UNet shows great potential in multimodal medical image segmentation.
DC-UNet can detect vague boundaries and avoid the interference of noise.
U-net: Convolutional networks for biomedical image segmentation.
